dt: {bc}a substance that emits a pleasant odor
{bc}a fluid preparation of natural essences (as from plants or animals) or synthetics and a fixative used for scenting

pt: {sc}fragrance{/sc} {sc}perfume{/sc} {sc}scent{/sc} {sc}redolence{/sc} mean a sweet or pleasant odor. {sc}fragrance{/sc} suggests the odors of flowers or other growing things.
{sc}perfume{/sc} may suggest a stronger or heavier odor.
{sc}scent{/sc} is very close to {sc}perfume{/sc} but of wider application because more neutral in connotation.
{sc}redolence{/sc} implies a mixture of fragrant or pungent odors.

pt.t: the {it}redolence{/it} of a forest after a rain

et: Middle French {it}perfum{/it}, probably from Old Occitan, from {it}perfumar{/it} to perfume, from {it}per-{/it} thoroughly (from Latin) + {it}fumar{/it} to smoke, from Latin {it}fumare{/it}, from {it}fumus{/it} smoke {ma}{mat|fume|}{/ma}
shortdef: a substance that emits a pleasant odor; especially : a fluid preparation of natural essences (as from plants or animals) or synthetics and a fixative used for scenting

dt: {bc}to fill or imbue with an odor

shortdef: to fill or imbue with an odor
